title: 109_hr280
content: The Act is titled the "Brownfields Redevelopment Enhancement Act" and its purpose is outlined in Section 2 as findings and purposes. The "Brownfields Redevelopment Enhancement Act" finds that returning brownfield sites to use can create jobs, generate tax revenues, protect natural resources, and address funding obstacles. The Department of Housing and Urban Development plays a key role in supporting community development and land use in urban areas through grants. The Department of Housing and Urban Development initiative provides funding for brownfields redevelopment activities, requiring communities to pledge community development block grant funds as collateral for a loan guarantee. Delinking grants from loan guarantees removes a barrier for many local communities. The Act aims to provide cities and towns with more flexibility and accessibility to funds for brownfields redevelopment by offering incentives and separating grants from community development block grant funds. SEC. 3. BROWNFIELDS DEVELOPMENT INITIATIVE. This section adds a new initiative for brownfields development to the Housing and Community Development Act of 1974. The Secretary may award grants to eligible public entities and Indian tribes for brownfield site development projects. Grant amounts must be used for specified activities and comply with certain requirements. The Secretary may award grants to eligible public entities and Indian tribes for brownfield site development projects. Grant amounts must be used for specified activities and comply with certain requirements. Assistance provided under this section shall not reduce the financial responsibility of any party responsible for contamination on real property. Grant eligibility does not require connection with projects assisted by a loan guaranteed under section 108. Applications for assistance must follow procedures established by the Secretary. Selection criteria and leveraging will be determined by the Secretary. The Secretary will establish criteria for awarding grants under this section, including financial leveraging considerations. The term 'brownfield site' is defined as per the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980. Authorization of appropriations is granted for grants under this section for fiscal years 2006-2010 to meet requirements for inclusion as a brownfield site under the Comprehensive Environmental Response, Compensation, and Liability Act of 1980. SEC. 4. CLARIFICATION OF BROWNFIELDS REDEVELOPMENT AS ELIGIBLE CDBG ACTIVITY. Technical Correction to Housing and Community Development Act of 1974, amending subsection (a) of section 105 by adding new paragraphs (20) and (21) and redesignating existing paragraphs. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to include new paragraphs related to economic development and redevelopment activities for brownfields sites. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to include new paragraphs related to projects for brownfields sites in conjunction with environmental regulatory agencies, without reducing financial responsibility of responsible parties for contamination on real property. The Housing and Community Development Act of 1974 is amended to allow the use of CDBG funds for renewal communities. The amendments apply to funds for fiscal year 2006 and beyond.
